verses.text: Likewise, ye wives, be in subjection to your own husbands; that, if any obey not the word, they also may without the word be won by the conversation of the wives;

similars.text: Wives, submit yourselves unto your own husbands, as unto the Lord.
Therefore as the church is subject unto Christ, so let the wives be to their own husbands in every thing.
Wives, submit yourselves unto your own husbands, as it is fit in the Lord.

Likewise, ye husbands, dwell with them according to knowledge, giving honour unto the wife, as unto the weaker vessel, and as being heirs together of the grace of life; that your prayers be not hindered.
For after this manner in the old time the holy women also, who trusted in God, adorned themselves, being in subjection unto their own husbands:

Take ye wives, and beget sons and daughters; and take wives for your sons, and give your daughters to husbands, that they may bear sons and daughters; that ye may be increased there, and not diminished.
Therefore as the church is subject unto Christ, so let the wives be to their own husbands in every thing.
Wives, submit yourselves unto your own husbands, as unto the Lord.
Wives, submit yourselves unto your own husbands, as it is fit in the Lord.

verses.text: While they behold your chaste conversation coupled with fear.
Whose adorning let it not be that outward adorning of plaiting the hair, and of wearing of gold, or of putting on of apparel;

similars.text: In like manner also, that women adorn themselves in modest apparel, with shamefacedness and sobriety; not with broided hair, or gold, or pearls, or costly array;

verses.text: But let it be the hidden man of the heart, in that which is not corruptible, even the ornament of a meek and quiet spirit, which is in the sight of God of great price.
For after this manner in the old time the holy women also, who trusted in God, adorned themselves, being in subjection unto their own husbands:

similars.text: Therefore as the church is subject unto Christ, so let the wives be to their own husbands in every thing.
Wives, submit yourselves unto your own husbands, as unto the Lord.
Wives, submit yourselves unto your own husbands, as it is fit in the Lord.

Likewise, ye husbands, dwell with them according to knowledge, giving honour unto the wife, as unto the weaker vessel, and as being heirs together of the grace of life; that your prayers be not hindered.
Likewise, ye wives, be in subjection to your own husbands; that, if any obey not the word, they also may without the word be won by the conversation of the wives;

verses.text: Even as Sara obeyed Abraham, calling him lord: whose daughters ye are, as long as ye do well, and are not afraid with any amazement.

Likewise, ye husbands, dwell with them according to knowledge, giving honour unto the wife, as unto the weaker vessel, and as being heirs together of the grace of life; that your prayers be not hindered.

similars.text: To be discreet, chaste, keepers at home, good, obedient to their own husbands, that the word of God be not blasphemed.
For after this manner in the old time the holy women also, who trusted in God, adorned themselves, being in subjection unto their own husbands:
Likewise, ye wives, be in subjection to your own husbands; that, if any obey not the word, they also may without the word be won by the conversation of the wives;

verses.text: Finally, be ye all of one mind, having compassion one of another, love as brethren, be pitiful, be courteous:

similars.text: Finally, brethren, farewell. Be perfect, be of good comfort, be of one mind, live in peace; and the God of love and peace shall be with you.
Be kindly affectioned one to another with brotherly love; in honour preferring one another;
And be ye kind one to another, tenderhearted, forgiving one another, even as God for Christ's sake hath forgiven you.
Behold, how good and how pleasant it is for brethren to dwell together in unity!
But whoso hath this world's good, and seeth his brother have need, and shutteth up his bowels of compassion from him, how dwelleth the love of God in him?

I know thy heart, and have heard thy prayers concerning thy brethren. Be not partial towards them in love above many others, but let thy love be for them as for thyself; and let thy love abound unto all men, and unto all who love my name.
Be kindly affectioned one to another with brotherly love; in honour preferring one another;
Finally, brethren, farewell. Be perfect, be of good comfort, be of one mind, live in peace; and the God of love and peace shall be with you.

verses.text: Not rendering evil for evil, or railing for railing: but contrariwise blessing; knowing that ye are thereunto called, that ye should inherit a blessing.
For he that will love life, and see good days, let him refrain his tongue from evil, and his lips that they speak no guile:

similars.text: Keep thy tongue from evil, and thy lips from speaking guile.
In the multitude of words there wanteth not sin: but he that refraineth his lips is wise.
Whoso keepeth his mouth and his tongue keepeth his soul from troubles.
He that keepeth his mouth keepeth his life: but he that openeth wide his lips shall have destruction.
Let him eschew evil, and do good; let him seek peace, and ensue it.
Keep thy tongue from evil, and thy lips from speaking guile.
My lips shall not speak wickedness, nor my tongue utter deceit.
In the multitude of words there wanteth not sin: but he that refraineth his lips is wise.

verses.text: Let him eschew evil, and do good; let him seek peace, and ensue it.

similars.text: Depart from evil, and do good; seek peace, and pursue it.
If he say thus, It is well; thy servant shall have peace: but if he be very wroth, then be sure that evil is determined by him.
Depart from evil, and do good; and dwell for evermore.
If he has desired to do evil, and has not repented in his days, behold, evil shall be done unto him, according to the restoration of God.
Be not overcome of evil, but overcome evil with good.
Acquaint now thyself with him, and be at peace: thereby good shall come unto thee.
Take him, and look well to him, and do him no harm; but do unto him even as he shall say unto thee.
Let not then your good be evil spoken of:
When a man's ways please the Lord, he maketh even his enemies to be at peace with him.
For he that will love life, and see good days, let him refrain his tongue from evil, and his lips that they speak no guile:
Depart from evil, and do good; seek peace, and pursue it.

verses.text: For the eyes of the Lord are over the righteous, and his ears are open unto their prayers: but the face of the Lord is against them that do evil.

similars.text: The eyes of the Lord are upon the righteous, and his ears are open unto their cry.
Behold, the eye of the Lord is upon them that fear him, upon them that hope in his mercy;
The eyes of the Lord are in every place, beholding the evil and the good.
The Lord openeth the eyes of the blind: the Lord raiseth them that are bowed down: the Lord loveth the righteous:
The face of the Lord is against them that do evil, to cut off the remembrance of them from the earth.
Therefore hath the Lord watched upon the evil, and brought it upon us: for the Lord our God is righteous in all his works which he doeth: for we obeyed not his voice.

Let thine ear now be attentive, and thine eyes open, that thou mayest hear the prayer of thy servant, which I pray before thee now, day and night, for the children of Israel thy servants, and confess the sins of the children of Israel, which we have sinned against thee: both I and my father's house have sinned.
Now, my God, let, I beseech thee, thine eyes be open, and let thine ears be attent unto the prayer that is made in this place.

Thou art of purer eyes than to behold evil, and canst not look on iniquity: wherefore lookest thou upon them that deal treacherously, and holdest thy tongue when the wicked devoureth the man that is more righteous than he?
The eyes of the Lord are upon the righteous, and his ears are open unto their cry.
The eyes of the Lord are upon the righteous, and his ears are open unto their cry.
The eyes of the Lord are in every place, beholding the evil and the good.
The Lord is far from the wicked: but he heareth the prayer of the righteous.
The face of the Lord is against them that do evil, to cut off the remembrance of them from the earth.
For the righteous Lord loveth righteousness; his countenance doth behold the upright.
The Lord openeth the eyes of the blind: the Lord raiseth them that are bowed down: the Lord loveth the righteous:

verses.text: And who is he that will harm you, if ye be followers of that which is good?
But and if ye suffer for righteousness' sake, happy are ye: and be not afraid of their terror, neither be troubled;

similars.text: For behold, the Lord will not suffer that ye shall live and wax strong in your iniquities to destroy his righteous people.
In righteousness shalt thou be established; thou shalt be far from oppression for thou shalt not fear, and from terror for it shall not come near thee.
In righteousness shalt thou be established: thou shalt be far from oppression; for thou shalt not fear: and from terror; for it shall not come near thee.
The fear of the Lord tendeth to life: and he that hath it shall abide satisfied; he shall not be visited with evil.
Be strong and of a good courage, fear not, nor be afraid of them: for the Lord thy God, he it is that doth go with thee; he will not fail thee, nor forsake thee.
Ye shall not therefore oppress one another; but thou shalt fear thy God: for I am the Lord your God.
Ye shall not fear them: for the Lord your God he shall fight for you.
And Joshua said unto them, Fear not, nor be dismayed, be strong and of good courage: for thus shall the Lord do to all your enemies against whom ye fight.

Therefore fear thou not, O my servant Jacob, saith the Lord; neither be dismayed, O Israel: for, lo, I will save thee from afar, and thy seed from the land of their captivity; and Jacob shall return, and shall be in rest, and be quiet, and none shall make him afraid.
For rulers are not a terror to good works, but to the evil. Wilt thou then not be afraid of the power? do that which is good, and thou shalt have praise of the same:
Thou shalt not be afraid of them: but shalt well remember what the Lord thy God did unto Pharaoh, and unto all Egypt;
Hearken unto me, ye that know righteousness, the people in whose heart is my law; fear ye not the reproach of men, neither be ye afraid of their revilings.
Rejoice not when thine enemy falleth, and let not thine heart be glad when he stumbleth:
Be not a terror unto me: thou art my hope in the day of evil.
He shall not be afraid of evil tidings: his heart is fixed, trusting in the Lord.
But he saith unto them, It is I; be not afraid.
Say to them that are of a fearful heart, Be strong, fear not: behold, your God will come with vengeance, even God with a recompence; he will come and save you.
Fear not, O land; be glad and rejoice: for the Lord will do great things.

verses.text: But sanctify the Lord God in your hearts: and be ready always to give an answer to every man that asketh you a reason of the hope that is in you with meekness and fear:

similars.text: Be of good courage, and he shall strengthen your heart, all ye that hope in the Lord.
Only fear the Lord, and serve him in truth with all your heart: for consider how great things he hath done for you.

verses.text: Having a good conscience; that, whereas they speak evil of you, as of evildoers, they may be ashamed that falsely accuse your good conversation in Christ.

similars.text: Having your conversation honest among the Gentiles: that, whereas they speak against you as evildoers, they may by your good works, which they shall behold, glorify God in the day of visitation.
Sound speech, that cannot be condemned; that he that is of the contrary part may be ashamed, having no evil thing to say of you.
Having your conversation honest among the Gentiles: that, whereas they speak against you as evildoers, they may by your good works, which they shall behold, glorify God in the day of visitation.
Sound speech, that cannot be condemned; that he that is of the contrary part may be ashamed, having no evil thing to say of you.

verses.text: For it is better, if the will of God be so, that ye suffer for well doing, than for evil doing.

similars.text: Therefore I say unto you, it shall be better for them than for you except ye repent.
To do justice and judgment is more acceptable to the Lord than sacrifice.
For it is God which worketh in you both to will and to do of his good pleasure.
For behold, God hath said a man being evil cannot do that which is good; for if he offereth a gift, or prayeth unto God, except he shall do it with real intent it profiteth him nothing.
Behold the Lord slayeth the wicked to bring forth his righteous purposes. It is better that one man should perish than that a nation should dwindle and perish in unbelief.

verses.text: For Christ also hath once suffered for sins, the just for the unjust, that he might bring us to God, being put to death in the flesh, but quickened by the Spirit:

similars.text: "For Christ also hath once suffered for sins, the just for the unjust, that he might bring us to God, being put to death in the flesh, but quickened by the Spirit:
And Jesus answering said unto him, Suffer it to be so now: for thus it becometh us to fulfil all righteousness. Then he suffered him.
And if Christ be in you, the body is dead because of sin; but the Spirit is life because of righteousness.
"For Christ also hath once suffered for sins, the just for the unjust, that he might bring us to God, being put to death in the flesh, but quickened by the Spirit:
"For Christ also hath once suffered for sins, the just for the unjust, that he might bring us to God, being put to death in the flesh, but quickened by the Spirit:

verses.text: By which also he went and preached unto the spirits in prison;

similars.text: "By which also he went and preached unto the spirits in prison;
And also they who are the spirits of men kept in prison, whom the Son visited, and preached the gospel unto them, that they might be judged according to men in the flesh;

And I wondered at the words of Peter--wherein he said that the Son of God preached unto the spirits in prison, who sometime were disobedient, when once the long-suffering of God waited in the days of Noah--and how it was possible for him to preach to those spirits and perform the necessary labor among them in so short a time.
And he released unto them him that for sedition and murder was cast into prison, whom they had desired; but he delivered Jesus to their will.
And as many of the spirits as were in prison came forth, and stood on the right hand of God; and the remainder were reserved in chains of darkness until the judgment of the great day.
Now when John had heard in the prison the works of Christ, he sent two of his disciples,
"By which also he went and preached unto the spirits in prison;
"By which also he went and preached unto the spirits in prison;
And also they who are the spirits of men kept in prison, whom the Son visited, and preached the gospel unto them, that they might be judged according to men in the flesh;

verses.text: Which sometime were disobedient, when once the longsuffering of God waited in the days of Noah, while the ark was a preparing, wherein few, that is, eight souls were saved by water.

verses.text: The like figure whereunto even baptism doth also now save us (not the putting away of the filth of the flesh, but the answer of a good conscience toward God,) by the resurrection of Jesus Christ:
Who is gone into heaven, and is on the right hand of God; angels and authorities and powers being made subject unto him.

similars.text: And ascended into heaven, to sit down on the right hand of the Father, to reign with almighty power according to the will of the Father;
And also the telestial receive it of the administering of angels who are appointed to minister for them, or who are appointed to be ministering spirits for them; for they shall be heirs of salvation.
